# SmartSpaces DFW - Copilot Instructions

## Project Overview
SmartSpaces DFW is a smart home installation company website built with:
- Next.js 14+ (App Router)
- React with TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Sanity CMS for content management

## Stack Details
- **Framework**: Next.js 14+ with App Router
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS
- **CMS**: Sanity Studio
- **Icons**: Lucide React
- **Deployment**: Vercel-ready

## Development Guidelines
- Use TypeScript for all components and utilities
- Follow Next.js 14 App Router patterns
- Implement responsive design with Tailwind CSS
- Use Sanity for all content management
- Focus on modern, tech-forward UI/UX for smart home industry

## Workspace Status
- [x] Created copilot-instructions.md
- [x] Project scaffolded with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind
- [x] Sanity CMS initialized with schemas (Service, Project, Testimonial, Page)
- [x] Modern homepage with smart home theme created
- [x] Dependencies installed and build verified
- [x] Development task created

## Next Steps
1. Create a Sanity account at https://sanity.io
2. Create a new project and get your Project ID
3. Copy `.env.local.example` to `.env.local` and add credentials
4. Deploy schema: `npx sanity schema deploy`
5. Start dev server: Task > Run Task > Dev Server (or `npm run dev`)
6. Access Studio at http://localhost:3000/studio to add content

## Design Theme
- Dark gradient backgrounds (slate-950 to blue-950)
- Blue/cyan accent colors for tech feel
- Modern glassmorphism effects
- Smart home iconography
- Responsive and mobile-friendly
